subject: AI
title: AI for Debugging
description: Leverage AI to find, explain, and fix bugs in your codebase.

hook.text: A bug has eluded the team for 3 days. A developer pastes the error and code into an AI chat. Fixed in 2 minutes.

buildup.text: AI excels at pattern-matching across millions of codebases it was trained on. It's seen your bug before â€” thousands of times.

discovery.text: Give the AI the error message, the relevant code, and what you expected. The more context you provide, the better the diagnosis.

twist.text: AI can confidently suggest the wrong fix. Always understand WHY the fix works before applying it, or you'll create new bugs.

climax.text: AI debugging shines for error messages, type mismatches, async issues, and off-by-one errors â€” the patterns it knows best.

punchline.text: Think of AI as a second pair of eyes that never gets tired and has read every Stack Overflow post.

quiz.question: What should you always do before applying an AI-suggested bug fix?
